data.title: Peaceful walk
data.text: This is such a peaceful little park off Broad Street. There are a number of historical markers and statues around the park. Many of the local tours include this on the walks, but you can just come through on your own and read the history. Inside the entrance from Meeting Street is the statue of George Washington for whom the park is named. There is also a bust of Henry Timrod on the Broad Street side. He was the poet laureate of SC at one time. There are benches so that you can sit and eat or just contemplate life. It is also an area where children can run around a bit. There are grassy areas and water fountains. Just outside the gate is a street vendor if you are hungry. It's well worth a look around.

data.title: Just a park with a little historical significance
data.text: If you need a shady park bench to rest on or some grass to play in this is a great area. Not much else to see or do other than that.

data.title: Relax in the shade on a bench
data.text:
You probably will have walked a lot when you make it to Washington Square at Broad and Meeting Streets. It is a great little park with manicured lawns, statues and monuments where you can sit on one of the benches under the giant oak trees. Tourists and locals alike will be sitting quietly on the other benches.
There is a nice statue of George Washington with a plaque that highlights some of his many accomplishments and details from his visit to Charleston in 1791.
This is a great place to relax for a little while and pay tribute to our greatest leader.

data.title: Pretty little park.
data.text: Yep, I’m rating a city park. Scraping the bottom of the barrel? Nah. This park is awesome. It has a statute of George Washington. And a bunch of trees. And it’s really quiet. And it’s quite a bit cooler here in the warm autumn sun than other places in town. What this park lacks in size, it makes up for in splendor. Between the beautiful old buildings, the old growth trees, and the pleasing layout, it makes for a great place to rest and relax while exploring the city.

data.title: Lovely for a stroll and a picnic .
data.text:
Photo opp. , cool shaded area , enjoy a bit of history and sit for a spell.
There are many lovely houses close by , and a cool beverage was enjoyed here.

data.title: Peaceful yet exciting place to visit
data.text: This is a true hidden treasure in Charleston. I didn't even know about it until my daughter had to do a project in school about local historic sites and she picked this one. Since then I love to visit this peaceful little park. There are numerous interesting statues throughout the park with plaques to give the history. Henry Timrod, a former poet laureate for the state of SC has a statue in this park along with many others. There are benches so that you can sit and just enjoy the birds or eat lunch. This little park is behind the City Hall building. There are three entrances and lots of little hidden treasures to view. During certain times of year, artists will set up and paint in the park as well.

data.title: Nice little square
data.text: This square is really cute to walk around and take pictures. Or grab a bench relax or read. It's a nice place to pass through

data.title: Washington Square in Charleston, SC
data.text: This is a charming small garden in the Historic district. As the name suggest, it is dedicated to George Washington whose statue is on a tall base. The base has a plaque which tell the main events of his life. In the center there is a monument to Washington Light Infantry and has names of famous battles inscribed in it. Come here to relax and enjoy the shade of old oaks and their beautiful Spanish moss.
